alert.note: Alert for Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 3:51AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River from Dubuque Iowa downstream through Burlington Iowa. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14. * WHEN...From Saturday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.4 feet, Water affects Princeton`s River Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Saturday morning and continue rising to 13.3 feet Tuesday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
